column1: shortish, a bit of movement in to cramp the left-hander. Looks to defend off the back foot and inside-edges into his thigh

once again a bit of movement, and there's an lbw appeal as it keeps a little low and sneaks under Pant's attempted pull. No footwork from Pant. The ball pitched outside leg and was going further down.
a bit fuller, swings in towards middle and off stump. Defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended towards short extra cover
fullish, swings down the leg side, tickles the pad through to the keeper as Pant misses the flick
length ball on middle stump, clipped away to the left of midwicket
length ball on off stump, pushed to mid-off with a nice, straight bat
length ball wide of off, throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge that flies away wide of slip. A bit of bounce on that
back of a length, angling in a touch too far, and Samson clips it away to the left of midwicket
back of a length, angling into off stump, tucks up Samson a little and he pushes cautiously into the covers
length ball on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg, who's just gone back. I assume fine leg is now in the circle
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the cover point region
length ball on off stump, maybe a tiny bit of nip in. Gets on the front foot to push to mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, punched to mid-on. I think he's wary of Dinda getting a bit of outswing. Didn't risk closing his face on this, just showed the full face
short, but there's a deep square leg in place and he sprints to his left to stop Samson's pull, which he fetched from outside off stump
full, perfect outswinger to a right-hander, but to the left-handed Pant it is a wide down the leg side
bowled. That's a pretty awful-looking shot from Pant, a big heave across the line. Just a regular length ball angled across to hit the top of off stump
wide outswinger, too much width, and Nair plants his front foot forward and slashes at it, gets a thick edge that flies to the third man boundary, easily beating the fielder running to his left
back of a length on off and middle, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, Samson plays a checked drive to mid-on

back of a length on off stump, and Samson is a little late taking off after poking that down towards mid-on. Fielder had work to do running in, and eventually the single is taken without too much fuss
fullish, just a touch outside off, and Nair leans into a sweetly timed drive that bisects cover point and extra cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
shortish, angling into leg stump, and Samson puts it away, whips it off his hips and places it to the right of short fine leg
length ball close to off stump, punched to cover point
fullish, too much width, and this time there's a whirling flourish as he gets on the front foot and strokes the ball away to the right of cover point
takes a couple of steps down the pitch to a back-of-a-length ball outside off, and then lets it come on for the dab down to third man
back of a length, angling into the body and cramping Samson as he looks to punch through the off side with no footwork. Inside edge onto thigh pad and then it rolls away to the right of the keeper
back of a length close to off stump, steered to third man with an open bat face
back of a length again, looked like a slower ball, and Samson waits and dabs to the left of third man
full-toss at waist height, just above I think, and Nair shows good reactions to take a quick back and across step and swat it away over short fine leg. No-ball signalled
full-toss wide of off stump, swinging away, and Nair slogs and misses, and his bat slips out of his grip and goes flying towards the square leg umpire
goes wide of the crease and angles a length ball into middle and off, blocked back down the ground, towards mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and pokes towards point

length ball outside off, and this one nips away a little as Nair shapes to defend, and he adjusts just a little to open his bat face and run it down to the third man boundary. Went off the edge, and finer than he intended, but it was halfway deliberate
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped away to the left of deep square leg
gone, chipped straight to midwicket. Looked to whip that length ball from an off-stump line, and maybe it stopped on him. Yeah, seemed to, and he ended up popping the simplest of catches to R Ashwin
back of a length, turning towards off stump, gets on the back foot to push to long-on
tossed up outside off, Duminy gets down low to lap it to the left of short fine leg
flighted ball on off stump, gets on the front foot to work it towards deep midwicket
down the track and Ashwin floats it up at his feet. Clipped to long-on
flatter and quicker, a back-of-a-length ball at the stumps. Nair opens up and punches down to long-on
shortish outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle and off, whipped away towards deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, drives on the up but R Ashwin dives to his left at short extra cover to stop it
slower ball, fullish on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to work that towards long-on
low full-toss outside off, pushed down the ground to long-off
slower ball, keeps low on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
quickish on middle stump, went with the angle from around the wicket. Duminy stays on the back foot to work it through square leg

down the track and that's nicely bowled by Ashwin, was it the seam-up ball. Hung in the air, dropped shorter than Nair expected, and floated away from his off stump. Poked away towards backward point off the outside edge
down the track and he fires it in full, clipped to midwicket
that's turn, and slow turn. Goes on the back foot to a ball that turns from middle stump - was looking to work it into the leg side, ended up defending with the full face
down the track and clips the straightish ball to long-on
full, flighted ball on off stump, driven to long-on
steps out of his crease and Bhatia bowls an extremely slow leg-roller outside off. All he can do is flat-bat to short extra cover
now he follows Nair as he looks to make room, another slower ball, and he punches it away towards sweeper cover
down the track to the length ball angled across him, shows the full face to pick up the single to long-off

down the track and this time he's close enough to the pitch of the Bhatia leg-roller to try to hit it over extra cover, but he ends up slicing it squarer than intended, and Thisara takes a good catch running to his right at sweeper cover

is that another? This legcutter grips and slides down the leg side as Duminy misses the flick, and he loses balance momentarily. Dhoni has the bails off in a flash, but I'm not sure if he's appealing for caught behind or stumped. He lifted his foot a fraction of an inch, momentarily, but he had it down by the time the bails started flashing, and I think if there was a noise, it was a clip off the outside of his thigh pad
fullish outside off, driven to long-off
length ball outside off, gets forward and pushes gently through point
down the track to the flighted ball on off stump, whips it with the turn towards deep midwicket
back of a length googly going towards off stump, worked to deep square leg
down the track and that legbreak dips and turns outside off. Billings has to stretch out to defend it, and it runs off the outside half of his bat towards short third man
googly again, turning towards off stump with some bounce, gets on the back foot to defend into the on side
down the wicket to the flighted ball on the stumps, clipped to the left of deep midwicket
short, another googly, this is turning away from off stump, offering width for the cut, and Thisara fumbles at the rope after running to his right from sweeper cover
slower ball floated a fair way down the leg side
down the track to another floaty slower ball, whips it to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, pushed to long-off
slower ball on off stump, no room, gets forward, lets it come on, and chops towards backward point
back of a length on middle and off, opens his bat face to squeeze it towards backward point
goes for the reverse-sweep to a ball on the stumps. It doesn't arrive in time, and he nearly toe-ends it back to the bowler. Hangs in the air for a bit but falls well short
slower ball on leg stump, reverse-swept to deep point
floated up nice and slow on off stump. Billings gets out of his crease to whip to long-on
tossed up wide of off, gets a long way forward to sweep it to deep square leg. Makes meaty, slapping contact with it
shapes to reverse-sweep and Ashwin floats it wide of leg (now off) stump
tossed up on off stump and Billings stays still this time, lets it drop, gets under it, and heaves it away over wide long-on
down the track and Ashwin looks to bowl it flatter and wider. Billings has to reach for this one, and does it well, uses his bottom hand brilliantly to shovel it over the long-off boundary
again he's out of his crease and he bowls it flat at his pads. Clipped to long-on
a step down the pitch to clip this from outside off to the right of deep square leg
down the track, and there's that powerful bottom hand again. It's flat, turning away sharply and forcing him to reach out outside off, and he flat-bats it powerfully back over the bowler
back of a length outside off and that googly surprises Billings with lots of extra bounce. Shapes to cut, pulls away from it, and gets a thick edge that loops over the keeper's right shoulder
back of a length googly outside off, chopped to point
slowish googly, Duminy gets down on one knee and pull-sweeps to deep square leg
again showed his intention to reverse-sweep too early, and the googly turns away from leg stump and beats him
another googly. Billings was going back to cut, didn't pick it, and by the time he hurriedly adjusted to try and play a pull-whip, he could only inside-edge into his thigh pad
slower ball on the pads, clipped away through square leg
in the blockhole outside off, jabbed to extra cover
slower ball on middle and off, driven to long-off

is that a switch hit? I think so. He switched hands, turned around in his stance, stepped away from what was now his leg stump, and then slogged this fullish slower ball on the stumps straight to long-off
very full on middle stump, pushed to long-off
slower ball on middle and leg, clipped gently to the right of midwicket
back of a length, googly, turning into the pads, tucked away through square leg
loopy full-toss outside off and that's Duminy's first boundary, swept away to the right of deep backward square leg
short googly outside off, chopped away towards deep point
tossed up, it's in Brathwaite's hitting zone, floaty and landing on middle and leg. He clears his front leg and effortlessly launches it into Row Q
back of a length, and he didn't pick the googly. He was stuck in the crease and it ripped into him and hit his pad, but it was sliding down leg
wallop! That's a full-toss on middle stump, and Brathwaite has sent that soaring into the suburbs
slower ball on middle stump. JP pokes it back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, clipped to long-on
yorker close to off stump, jams his bat down on it and sends it rolling gently to mid-off

whooooooooooooo, that is a sensational hit. It's fullish on off stump, but not full enough, and this is more wrist that anything, a flat, flat-bat whip that sails over the gap between bowler and mid-off
slower bouncer does the trick. Brathwaite fetches the pull from shoulder height, from outside off, and can't clear Thisara on the square leg boundary

slower short ball outside off, pulled towards deep midwicket, and that is a super throw from Rahane, flat, accurate, one-bounce, and Dhoni collected an inch over the top of the stumps and did the rest with Duminy a good two feet short of completing his second run
short outside off, slapped to deep point
flat carrom ball on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up outside leg, looked like the legbreak. Jayant misses the sweep and earns his side a wide
tossed up on off stump. Looks for the pushed single to long-on but midwicket moves quickly to his left to cut it off
flat, down the leg side again, and Yadav can't connect with his sweep
back of a length, turning into the pads, tucked through square leg

flat and quick on the pads, clipped to deep square leg, and it looks like we have another run-out. They go for a second again, and Saurabh Tiwary hits the stumps direct at the bowler's end with a flat, one-bounce throw
back of a length outside off, no turn, chopped towards backward point

full-toss wide of off, and Negi misses out. He could have flat-batted it through the covers, but he's opened up too much, perhaps looking leg-side premeditatedly, and ends up hitting down the ground to long-off
shortish slower ball on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
makes a lot of room by stepping away from leg stump and Boland bowls a slower ball outside off. Flat-batted to long-off again
in the blockhole on middle and leg, clipped to long-on
very full outside off, flat-batted to long-off again. Boland isn't giving him anything in his swinging area
slower bouncer outside off. Shami doesn't pick it, shapes to pull, stops himself, and ends up playing no stroke as it rolls down to the keeper
low full-toss wide of off, saw him backing away from leg stump again. And he can only squeeze it down the ground towards long-off
slower ball outside off and Negi goes down on one knee, slogs, doesn't come anywhere near middling it, and somehow manages to clear long-on
excellent yorker, angling across and not missing off stump by much. Negi looked to stab it through point, couldn't connect
another yorker outside off, again he can't jam his bat down quickly enough and the ball sneaks through to the keeper
down the track and the attempted wide yorker turns into a wide full-toss, and he slaps it away over extra cover
low full-toss outside off, sliced away to deep point. Went close to the fielder, but they didn't even attempt the second. What did they have to lose?
flighted ball outside off, gets on the front foot to defend to short cover
floated up again, but the line's too straight, turns down the leg side and Rahane flicks it away to the left of the keeper and it runs away for four
slow flight outside off, comes forward and dabs to short third man, runs out of his crease, and the non-striker sends him back
fuller this time, outside off, clipped to long-on
floated up on middle stump, driven to long-off
a bit quicker on a fullish length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers
back of a length outside off, whipped to midwicket
shortish, not that much width, but Khawaja doesn't need much, just stands there and uses his hands and wrists to flay that away to the right of backward point
length ball on middle stump, slower one, clipped to short fine leg
back of a length slower ball outside off, dabbed to third man
short on middle stump, pulled to deep square leg
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to backward square leg
tossed up wide of off, drags the sweep out to deep square leg
flat, back of a length on off, jumps back to pull to long-on

a bit of flight on off stump and Khawaja goes after it even though long-off is back, and even though it wasn't full enough in his hitting area. Miscues, and Brathwaite runs in, dives forward, gets both hands to the ball low down, but can't hold on
shortish outside off, chopped into the covers
length ball on off stump, whipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, flat-batted to mid-off and sets off for a suicidal single, and JP misses the stumps at the bowler's end with Khawaja nowhere near the crease
short, rising ball angling down leg and Rahane only gets a bit of glove on the pull. Samson throws himself to his left, stretches his arm out, and it just eludes his left glove
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, clipped away to the left of deep square leg
length ball on off stump, whipped to deep square leg
fullish, slanting away from off stump. Khawaja throws his bat at it, looking to crash that through the covers, and gets a thick edge down to the third man boundary
down the track and Jayant spots it and bowls the flat straighter one on off stump. Opens up Rahane a touch as he shapes to play into the on side and he gets a thick edge down to backward point
flighted length ball outside off, clipped to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
down the track and again Jayant pulls his length back subtly without firing it in. Clipped to long-on
down the track, and he picks the right moment to do this, after the field change. The line is outside off, and he can free his arms and loft it over mid-off
quickish, back of a length on off stump, no turn. Goes back to cut, maybe, and is cramped for room, and ends up swiping it into the midwicket region

shortish, and Khawaja is through his pull too quick, and is hit on the midriff. They try and sneak the single, and Khawaja and Shami collide mid-pitch as Shami tries to get to the ball. He turns around, throws at the bowler's end, and misses with Khawaja only halfway down the pitch
shortish on middle stump, and Rahane puts it away with super timing, uses his wrists to pull-whip through square leg
length ball on middle stump and there are those wrists again, clips it and times it superbly, beats midwicket to his right and beats a sprinting, diving deep square leg to his left
shortish, close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to third man
shortish on off stump, pulled straight to midwicket
shortish again, this time he pulls squarer, to the right of deep square leg, but doesn't really get too much meat into the shot. He seemed a little cramped for room
length ball outside off, goes on the back foot to slap to deep point
tossed up on off stump, drops on a nice length, and Khawaja has to be watchful as he drives to long-off, that could easily dip a bit and turn past his inside edge
back-of-a-length googly, cramps Rahane as he rocks back to cut, and he has to adjust and work it through square leg in the end
back of a length googly outside off, dabbed to short third man

lovely, lovely bowling. Floated up slower, and it drops shorter than Khawaja expects as he plays a wavy drive away from his body, and it's the googly, turns away and beats his outside edge as he stretches out. Samson has the bails off quickly, and it goes upstairs, but the back foot was planted firmly enough, with a fair part of it behind the crease

quickish, down the leg side. I think Mishra saw him stepping out, and fired it in. He looks to hurriedly whip into the leg side, can't put bat on ball, and it rolls to Samson off his thigh pad, and the keeper fumbles and muffs up a possible stumping
length ball on off stump, clipped to deep square leg
down the track and Jayant shortens his length nicely outside off, driven down to long-off
down the track and Jayant bowls a slow, slow straighter one that he clips quietly to long-on
quicker ball, and Khawaja doesn't pick the change of pace. Plays all around it, and it goes through straight and hits him on the pad, but it was heading down the leg side
down the track and he drives inside-out through cover
tossed up outside off, leans forward for the lap sweep towards deep backward square leg
full on middle stump, whipped hard but straight back to the bowler

down the track and this time Samson doesn't make a mistake. Beautifully bowled again, slows it down, drops it shorter than Khawaja expected, and it's the googly again. Didn't seem to pick it, looked to heave it over the leg side, and didn't come anywhere near connecting
back of a length googly, and I'm not sure he picked it. Pushed hard at it with his hands, with an open face, and managed to squeeze it to the left of the slip fielder
floated up outside off, but it's too full for Tiwary to connect cleanly with his slog, ends up dragging it along the ground to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to whip to long-on
another googly. Stretches out to defend and gets a thick edge to short third man
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
short, turns away sharply and he has to drag that pull from wide outside off. Mishits it, skews it high in the air, but it drops well short of Brathwaite coming in from long-on
flighted, a bit too much width, and Rahane plays that inside-out loft over extra cover that he plays so well
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease to whip to deep midwicket
down the track and JP tucks him up with a full one at his feet. Clipped to long-on
fired in very full outside off, flat-batted to long-off
floated up wide of off stump, left alone
wide of off stump again, but drops shorter and it's the googly. Rahane rocks back and plays the topspin whip to long-on
back of a length wrong 'un, turning away from off stump. Tiwary goes on the back foot, pokes, and misses
down the track and he doesn't quite reach the pitch of this googly. Goes through with the slog anyway and clears the wide long-on boundary
full and flat on off stump, driven back firmly to the bowler, who has overstepped, the umpire reveals
another no-ball. This one's a high full-toss outside off, and Tiwary clubs it to long-on
flat on off stump, and Rahane clears his front leg, slogs it down deep midwicket's throat
back of a length on off stump, whipped into the on side and Mishra moves quickly to stop it in his follow-through
flat googly outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
fullish on off stump, clipped to the left of long-on
low full-toss outside off, swiped to long-on
googly, a bit of flight. Rahane comes forward and slightly overbalances while defending it
shortish on off stump, whipped to deep square leg
googly, fetches the sweep from outside off and hits it to deep square leg
oh my, I think the ball got stuck in Tahir's hand, dragged it extremely short and slung it down the leg side as well
flighted and full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
slower ball, back of a length, whipped away through midwicket
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
fullish on off stump, Rahane makes a bit of room to steer to deep point
slower ball close to off stump, dabbed to short third man
short, down the leg side, Rahane gets just enough on that pull to beat Samson diving to his left

slower ball outside off, shuffles across and clips to deep midwicket. Ooh, looks like Brathwaite's fluffed a run-out chance. Tiwary was slow getting to the bowler's end, the throw was flat and straight to the bowler, and he fumbled it
in the blockhole on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, and Tiwary slog-sweeps straight to deep midwicket
down the track and he shortens his length nicely. It skids through straight and hits Dhoni's pad as he plays across it
tossed up nicely on off stump and Dhoni is opened up by the dip and turn. Pokes away from his body to push into the covers
shortish, turning away from off stump, pulled to long-on
length ball, whipped from outside off towards deep midwicket to bring up his fifth half-century of the season
back of a length on off stump, whipped to long-on
down the track, and that is huuuuge. Dhoni jumps down, gets to the pitch, and frees his arms to launch that high, back over the bowler's head
flat length ball wide of off, left alone
flat, angling into the body, swiped to the left of short fine leg
fullish and flat close to off stump, clipped to long-on
flat, back of a length on middle stump, worked away to deep midwicket
back of a length googly, cramps Dhoni for room and he whips it to deep midwicket
tossed up wide of off, Rahane plays the flat-bat drive to sweeper cover
another quickish googly, back of a length, and Dhoni has no room to do anything but poke back to the bowler

quickish, fuller this time, Dhoni comes forward to work it leg side and it's the googly, beats his inside edge and rolls into the leg side off his pad. A bit of hesitation, and the bowler runs quickly to pick up the ball and throw to the keeper's end, ends up hitting Rahane on the body
back of a length at the body, whipped to deep midwicket
in the blockhole outside off. Looks to drive through the covers but it's too full for that, and he jabs it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket
googly wide of off, too full to get any elevation, and he hits the slog hard but on the bounce to long-on
slower now, on off stump, drags his sweep out to deep backward square leg
quickish skidder on middle stump, Dhoni swipes at it and gets an inside edge onto his pad, dribbles into the backward point region

googly, cramps Rahane as he rocks back to pull, and can only whip it out to deep midwicket again. He wants the second, but is sent back. Billings' throw is a rocket at the bowler's end, and Rahane was short of his crease, but Mishra fumbles it
shortish and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
short, and Dhoni pulls it fiercely but straight to deep square leg
sees Rahane looking to make room, looks to follow him, ends up sliding it far wider of leg stump than he intended, and even the keeper diving full-length can't stop it
length ball on middle stump - saw Rahane moving around his crease and aimed at the stumps - and it's whipped to long leg
quick short ball outside off, rises to shoulder height, and Dhoni top-edges his pull over the keeper
down the track, and that is a stunning hit. Gets to the pitch of it and uses his wrists to whip it over the long-on boundary and into the sightscreen

back of a length outside off, Dhoni knows third man is inside the ring, and he dabs it cutely to his right, and it looked like four all the way before Brathwaite came hurtling in from deep point and tumbled to his left to cut it off at the rope
short slower one outside off, pulled to deep square leg

what a catch that is! Dhoni slogged at this flattish length ball, didn't hit it too well, didn't hit it too badly, and it could have gone for six if Sam Billings, running to his right, had not leaped across to pluck it out of the air, above his head, and go tumbling to the ground and come up with the ball still stuck in his hands
full outside off, dragged to long-on with a lot of bottom hand
googly wide of off stump, and that's the perfect ball for a leggie to bowl to Perera, but what do you do when he fetches it from wide outside off and slogs it high and clean over long-on
is that a missed stumping? It was the quick googly, and it snuck between Perera's legs as he missed the flick, and Samson fumbles, but Perera hadn't stepped out of his crease
length ball on the stumps, and Perera clears his front leg and sends it soaring over deep midwicket
wide googly again. Perera slogs across the line, toe-ends it and it's racing away behind the wicket before Pant dives to his right from short third man to stop it

slower ball close to off stump, Perera slogs too early, miscues it in the air, wide of extra cover, and the fielder runs to his right, catches it, and looks up to see the umpire signal no-ball. Big no-ball too.
full, on the pads, clipped away crisply to the square leg boundary
